card1.description: Understand the importance of Yin-Yang balance as the foundation of health in Traditional Chinese Medicine.
card1.title: Yin and Yang Theory

card2.description: Explore the interaction of the Five Elements and their impact on body and mind.
card2.title: Five Elements Theory

card3.description: Learn about the role of Zang-Fu organs in maintaining balance and health.
card3.title: Zang-Fu Organs Theory

card4.description: Discover the meridian system, channels that connect the body and promote the flow of Qi.
card4.title: Meridian System

card5.description: Understand the causes and mechanisms of diseases according to Traditional Chinese Medicine.
card5.title: Etiology and Pathogenesis

card6.description: Learn practical tips for preserving health through diet, lifestyle, and seasonal adjustments.
card6.title: Health Preservation

card1.description: Consume foods like astragalus, codonopsis, and jujube to boost Qi. Prevent fatigue, shortness of breath, and susceptibility to illness.
card1.title: Qi Deficiency Health Tips

card2.description: Eat foods like angelica, goji berries, and black sesame to nourish blood. Prevent anemia, dizziness, and pale complexion.
card2.title: Blood Deficiency Health Tips

card3.description: Consume warming foods like lamb, ginger, and cinnamon to strengthen Yang. Prevent cold intolerance, poor digestion, and fatigue.
card3.title: Yang Deficiency Health Tips

card4.description: Eat foods like white fungus, lily bulbs, and goji berries to nourish Yin. Prevent night sweats, dry mouth, and insomnia.
card4.title: Yin Deficiency Health Tips

card1.description: Consume fiber-rich and antioxidant foods like oats, apples, and grapes. Control fat and salt intake, maintain moderate exercise, and avoid overexertion.
card1.title: Cardiovascular Disease Prevention

card2.description: Eat mild and easily digestible foods like millet porridge, yam, and pumpkin. Eat at regular intervals, avoid overeating, and manage stress.
card2.title: Digestive System Disease Prevention

card3.description: Consume lung-nourishing foods like pears, white fungus, and lily bulbs. Avoid getting cold, monitor air quality, and engage in regular outdoor activities.
card3.title: Respiratory System Disease Prevention

card1.description: Consume collagen-rich and antioxidant foods like pig's trotters, fish maw, and goji berries. Ensure adequate sleep, reduce UV exposure, and supplement with vitamin C.
card1.title: Beauty and Skincare

card2.description: Eat low-fat, high-fiber foods like oats, green tea, and vegetables. Maintain regular exercise, control portion sizes, and avoid high-calorie snacks.
card2.title: Weight Loss

card3.description: Consume vitamin C and zinc-rich foods like citrus fruits, nuts, and milk. Exercise regularly, maintain a positive mindset, and ensure adequate sleep.
card3.title: Immune System Boost

card1.description: Eat warming foods like onion, ginger, and garlic to boost Yang energy. Prevent colds and allergies, and take care of your liver.
card1.title: Spring Health Tips

card2.description: Consume cooling foods like mung beans, bitter melon, and watermelon. Prevent heatstroke and digestive issues, and stay hydrated.
card2.title: Summer Health Tips

card3.description: Eat nourishing foods like pears, white fungus, and lily bulbs. Prevent dryness-related issues like respiratory problems and dry skin.
card3.title: Autumn Health Tips

card4.description: Consume warming foods like lamb, goji berries, and red dates. Prevent cold-related illnesses and maintain kidney health.
card4.title: Winter Health Tips
